_header: Have mercy upon me O God
_description: The psalm ‘Miserere’ arranged as a translation of the Asperges — in couplets with a 4-line pseudo-burden

BLAdd32427.First Lines: Haue mercy uppon me o godAfter thy great mercy…
BLAdd32427.Last Lines:
…And according to the multitude of thy mercysDo a wey my
                    wyckydness
BLAdd32427.Note:
Burden: ‘Remember your promys made yn baptysm / And crystys
                    mercyffull bloud shedyng / By the wyche most holy sprynklyng / off all your syns
                    you haue fre pardun’. Verse is followed by a ‘glory be’:
                    ‘Glory be to the father & to the sun & to the holy goost. As hyt
                    was yn the begynnyng so now & euer yn the world off worlds so be
                    hytt’.

Frere,  Walter Howard. 
             Antiphonale Sarisburiense: a reproduction in facsimile….
